Sad to see Marly La Roi so dilapidated when you consider that this was the playground to Louis XIV, XV & XVI.

What a joy to visit here. This museum has been recently renovated and it shows. The collection is well balanced and tells basically two stories. One of the not-so-well-known parts of the life of Louis XIV, who had a palace on this estate he used for private events. The other is the story of the famed Marly Machine, a system to pump water from the Seine and bring it up to Marly (and then on to Versailles) to use in the fountains and ponds. The friendly and knowledgeable staff will tell you all about this, and you will be happy to have learned something not everybody knows about.
AWESOME park !! Enough space to picnic, exercise, reminisce about history. Etc
Great place for walking, going on a picnic, reading ‚ô•Ô∏è on the whole, relaxing üëç ‚Ä¶
Impressive insights in premodern innovative living
Loved the Gardens...

The park is free and open to access. Don't be surprised, there are very few remains. The museum is very disappointing. 10‚Ç¨ to ultimately have very little information or period objects. Lots of added parts. In the end there are only a few rooms with two models. No documentary video screenings on site. No restitution of the castle is intended while many supposed visuals exist. You won't stay more than 30 minutes and that's a shame.
Majestic park from Louis XIV to the present day. Guided tour of the museum with the exhibition on The King's Horses. Very enriching, very beautiful works

A very interesting little museum, it allows you to understand the arrival of water at the time of the great fountains of Versailles. The models allow you to imagine the beauty of the castle at the time

Parking may be difficult on weekends, but free parking is available inside the park on weekdays. The park is beautiful and taking a walk around Mahli is a fun place, and there is no separate admission fee.
magnificent museum, lots of things to discover and learn for geo history enthusiasts
The park is pleasant, not too busy but I recommend the museum. Indeed, you will see the castle as it was at the time as well as explanations on the Marly machine...

This small museum has just reopened its doors You will have the opportunity to see a very beautiful overall model of the ‚ÄúMarly machine‚Äù which allowed water to be brought up from the Seine towards the Palace of Versailles. Furthermore, detailed models explain how the pumps work. And then you can visit the site of the Ch√¢teau de Marly.  Currently (June 2024) Superb exhibition on the theme of horses in Marly This exhibition brings together rare and unique pieces, found by the Curator and her teams.

Very beautiful little modern museum whose theme is the Chateau de Marly, private domain of Louis XIV. This museum explains the irrigation system of the Chateau de Marly and to a lesser extent of Versailles. It is very well done and shows the civil engineering of the time. The people at the museum are passionate and explain things precisely to you.
Splendid museum, very interesting to do in addition to a walk in the magnificent park. Very beautiful paintings of the site, beautiful models of the impressive Marly machine

Small museum not uninteresting historically. However, for what is presented in the galleries, approximately 45 minutes of visit, the price of 10‚Ç¨ is not justified. In addition, the leaflet to visit the park was too succinct for my taste. In short, the museum has little interest unless you are passionate about the period.

Visit at opening at 2 p.m. on weekdays. I was alone to explore the permanent and temporary exhibitions. It's a shame that the tranquility of the place was spoiled by a member of staff who was keen to follow me like my shadow while recounting his life out loud and intelligibly to his new colleague who seemed as embarrassed as me. As a result, to my great despair, I learned more about his life than about the Ch√¢teau de Marly, the machine and the horses...  Apart from this very unpleasant social experience, the museum is very interesting, very well documented and the scenography is well done. We delve into the King's stays in Marly and better understand the functioning of the legendary machine which transported water from the Seine to the heights of Versailles.
Very interesting site for fans of the Sun King. Please note, the small museum is closed until the beginning of 2018.
Very pretty gardens for a nice little stroll.
Exhibition not fully available But I will come back It's very beautiful
Small museum but worth visiting to better understand the area. The Marly horse exhibition was interesting. Thanks to Charles for his valuable comments.
Friendly museum dedicated to the Ch√¢teau de Marly. Beautiful scenography - 7 euros entry
A very nice discovery of a little-known place.
We imagine the castle in the middle of this immense garden... taking an hour to walk there is ideal.
Discovery of this magnificent museum, a good discovery.
Very interesting visit. During the museum night it was really nice to learn all the history of this place

Very nice exhibition on the art of adorning oneself at Court. Enthusiastic conservatives who share their stories and don't just sit in a chair.  Thanks to Charles for his explanations.  In addition, the museum has a magnificent garden.
Top, very pleasant staff and full of anecdotes. We had a great time as a family discovering the history of this royal pavilion and this incredible machine. I fully recommend.

Extremely limited (bordering on the ridiculous for a ‚Ç¨7 note) the objects and paintings on display. And shh, so that it doesn't show too much when comparing to other museums which respect themselves and have no restrictions on taking videos, here it's forbidden to take them, with a real dog on guard...
Visit a little expensive for what is on display and constantly followed by a young man in a tracksuit for what role?

The place is very nice but the security guard is not polite! He closed the doors at 7:10 p.m. although it closes at 7:30 p.m. as shown on the gates! He drives around the park with the car without any respect for the visitors and the dust that spreads because of his speeding!! Honestly shame on him!

Magnificent exhibition on seduction under Louis XIV, rich in accessories and especially the guided tour which I particularly recommend because the guide is inexhaustible on the subject. Congratulations and thank you for your skill!

Very beautiful museum which allows us to discover the Marly estate under the Ancien R√©gime and the mechanisms for transporting water to supply the fountains of Marly and Versailles (in all simplicity with elements operated by the visitor). Warm welcome, real PRM accessibility.
Very nice place close to the noise...
Great museum, just a small downside: it's a little small, otherwise nothing to say. And also great royal estate.

Small but rich! This is the phrase that goes to this museum. We learn about this famous Ch√¢teau de Marly and the machine (8th wonder of the world at the time, according to what was said). I recommend the virtual reality workshop, which completely immerses you in this castle. I thank the gentleman present this afternoon for his clear and rich explanations.

Small, friendly museum around the Marly machine and the Marly park. The supervisors kindly want to provide information but do not always master their subject. Too expensive for its size limited to a few rooms (‚Ç¨7 full price, ‚Ç¨5 reduced price in May 2022). Eliminate the distribution of unnecessary badges at the entrance and lower the price.
